body: I think mentioning it in the guide should be fine. Extra checks would potentially slow down production environments.
That sounds good. I'd not use pipe for a hash though.

The pipe is just for separating the string which is to be hash correctly. So

    /path/to/asset2.0.10

does not get confused with

    /path/to/asset2.0.11

I'd be fine with any other char, which does not occur in version.
Sorry, the pipe is fine. I've thought it's added to the hash itself but it's actually being fed to crc32.

issue.title: add value of linkAssets to string which is to be hashed, fixes #14913

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

| Tests pass?   | ?
| Fixed issues  | #14913

body:
Hello,

I have some troubles after updating to 2.0.13 related to these modifications.

I'm using advanced app in which I have theme folder with some js & images:

frontend/themes/assets/images/favicon.ico
frontend/themes/default/assets/js/html5shiv.min.js
frontend/themes/default/assets/js/respond.min.js

in layout i get them as following:

    <link href="<?= Yii::$app->assetManager->getPublishedUrl('@frontend/themes/default/assets/') ?>/images/favicon.ico" rel="shortcut icon" type="image/x-icon">
    <!--[if lt IE 9]>
    <script src="<?= Yii::$app->assetManager->getPublishedUrl('@frontend/themes/default/assets/') ?>/js/html5shiv.min.js" type="text/javascript"></script>
    <script src="<?= Yii::$app->assetManager->getPublishedUrl('@frontend/themes/default/assets/') ?>/js/respond.min.js" type="text/javascript"></script>
    <![endif]-->

If 'linkAssets' => true then those files cannot be accessed by generated url (404 not found).
If 'linkAssets' => false, everything is good.

How are these changes related to your issues, they "just" hash another string.

Does it work when you manually revert those changes?
Which system are you on?

> How are these changes related to your issues, they "just" hash another string.

The problem is that generated url links to a folder/symlink that doesn't exist (with 'linkAssets' => true).

> Does it work when you manually revert those changes?

Yes, it works if I revert code manually to 2.0.12, it works also when I change 'linkAssets' => false.

> Which system are you on?

ubuntu 14.04 lts

Do you also publish the assets beforehard, according to the [docs](http://www.yiiframework.com/doc-2.0/yii-web-assetmanager.html#getPublishedUrl()-detail), there is no publishing made by calling `getPublishedUrl()`.

Did you switch the setting from time to time? I am asking because I'd like to know if things "went right" for you, due to https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/pull/14905#issuecomment-334139197

> Do you also publish the assets beforehard, according to the docs, there is no publishing made by calling getPublishedUrl().

Yes, I publish assets before with command: php yii asset/compress frontend/assets/compress/config.php frontend/assets/compress/assets-prod.php

> Did you switch the setting from time to time? I am asking because I'd like to know if things "went right" for you, due to #14905 (comment)

No, I didn't switched settings since option linkAssets => true was added. 

(not sure about what is #14905, I'll take a look later)

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

body:
> https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/pull/14905#issuecomment-334142493

even if we switch  linkAssets from false to true and republish them, images & js are published under a folder and work only if linkAssets are changed to false.

> `php yii asset/compress frontend/assets/compress/config.php frontend/assets/compress/assets-prod.php`

@samdark Is this equivalent to `assetManager->publish()` for compressed assets?
